identificationModule.briefTitle: Upper Extremity Rehabilitation Using Robot and Botulinum Toxin

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Concomitant use of botulinum toxin and robot would make better results regarding upper extremity function compared to robot, botulinum toxin, or no intervention.

armGroups.label: Early Inmotion and Botox
armGroups.description: Concomitant use of Inmotion and botulinum toxin from the baseline

armGroups.label: Botox, then Inmotion
armGroups.description: Inmotion training 4 weeks after botulinum toxin injection

armGroups.label: Inmotion, then Botox
armGroups.description: From the baseline Inmotion, then Botox injection at 4 weeks after baseline

armGroups.label: Late Inmotion and Botox
armGroups.description: No intervention, then Inmotion and Botox injection at 4 weeks from the baseline

interventions.name: Early Inmotion and Botox
interventions.description: Concomitant use of Inmotion and Botox from the baseline

interventions.name: Botox, then Inmotion
interventions.description: At baseline Botox injection and 4 weeks after Inmotion

interventions.name: Inmotion, then Botox
interventions.description: Inmotion from the baseline, then Botox injection at 4 weeks after baseline

interventions.name: Late Inmotion and Botox
interventions.description: No intervention until 4 weeks from the baseline. Then Inmotion and Botox injection

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Hemiplegic patients secondary to first cerebrovascular accidents
* Shoulder or Elbow flexor spasticity above or modified ashworth scale 1+
* Cognitively intact enough to understand and follow the instructions from the investigator

Exclusion Criteria:

* History of surgery of affected upper limb
* Fracture of affected upper limb
* Recent history of botulinum toxin injection within 6 months
